trans-unit.source: Provides design-time support for <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone"></xref> controls.

<xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner> provides a design-time representation of a <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> control with a menu to access the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> collection and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ToolZoneDesigner.ViewInBrowseMode%2A> property for the convenience of the page developer.
It is the only zone designer that does not support designer regions.
This is because <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> controls uses links to create connections instead of a drag-and-drop user interface (UI).

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> collection and the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ToolZoneDesigner.ViewInBrowseMode%2A> property both appear on the verbs menu of the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> control.
<xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.AutoFormats%2A>, when selected, provides a selection of color schemes.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ToolZoneDesigner.ViewInBrowseMode%2A> check box, when selected, displays the contents of the control as it would appear in the browser; the control will be empty until a connection is made.

You can inherit from <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner> to support a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> control as with any other control designer.
You can override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method to change the markup that renders the control.

You can also override the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> collection to add a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection> with a custom scheme.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner"></xref> class.
Gets the collection of predefined automatic formatting schemes to display in the **Auto Format** dialog box for the associated control at design time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.AutoFormats%2A> property overrides its base implementation to get a predefined collection that is specific to the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> class.
A predefined <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.DesignerAutoFormatCollection"></xref> with a default ConnectionZone scheme.
Gets the markup that is used to represent the control at design time.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that is the markup to represent the control at design time.
Binds the designer to the specified <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone"></xref> control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone"></xref> control associated with the designer.
Hides a preset group of properties at design time.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZoneDesigner.PreFilterProperties%2A> method overrides the parent method to hide the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.EmptyZoneTextStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.PartChromeStyle%2A>, <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.PartStyle%2A>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.WebZone.PartTitleStyle%2A> properties in the designer.
This is because the properties in question are not rendered by <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ConnectionsZone> controls and are therefore not relevant.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IDictionary"></xref> of the set of properties associated with the control.
